issue.title: No mails are sent when providers offer AUTH PLAIN authentification only

repository.name: passbolt_api
repository.description: Passbolt Community Edition (CE) API. The JSON API for the open source password manager for teams!

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## Unable to send Emails to some providers

* Passbolt Version: e848cd4d9ef8982e405ee8350fca325e2c562fad
* Platform and Target:
-- Operating system: Debian Buster (10)
-- PHP: 7.3.14-1~deb10u1
-- Web server: nginx/1.14.2
-- Database server: mariadb  Ver 15.1
-- etc.: Vserver

### What you did
I installed passbolt with the script, everything was working as expected and went very smooth. Except the email sending part. I startet a forum thread with my problems here: https://community.passbolt.com/t/emails-not-sending/2771 

First I thought it was the same with every provider, then I found a provider that worked for me (without TLS and instead with the ssl:// URL) Still the provider I want to use doesnt not work in passbolt. I tried connecting to it manually and in the end did so successfully. From the same system and the same user/pass combination. See [this post](https://community.passbolt.com/t/emails-not-sending/2771/5) for an exact output of a successful connection.

### What happened

Although my email is working in thunderbird/webmail/manual smtp it is not working in passbolt.
```
# sudo -u www-data /var/www/passbolt/bin/cake passbolt  send_test_email --recipient=my@email.com

     ____                  __          ____  
    / __ \____  _____ ____/ /_  ____  / / /_ 
   / /_/ / __ `/ ___/ ___/ __ \/ __ \/ / __/ 
  / ____/ /_/ (__  |__  ) /_/ / /_/ / / /    
 /_/    \__,_/____/____/_.___/\____/_/\__/   

 Open source password manager for teams
---------------------------------------------------------------
 Debug email shell
---------------------------------------------------------------

Email configuration
---------------------------------------------------------------
Host: mail.systemli.org
Port: 587
Username: myworkingusername
Password: *********
TLS: true

Sending email from: myemailname
Sending email to: my@email.com
---------------------------------------------------------------

Trace
[220] mail1.systemli.org ESMTP Postfix (Debian/GNU)
> EHLO localhost
[250] mail1.systemli.org
[250] PIPELINING
[250] SIZE 40960000
[250] ETRN
[250] STARTTLS
[250] ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES
[250] 8BITMIME
[250] DSN
[250] CHUNKING
> STARTTLS
[220] 2.0.0 Ready to start TLS
> EHLO localhost
[250] mail1.systemli.org
[250] PIPELINING
[250] SIZE 40960000
[250] ETRN
[250] AUTH PLAIN
[250] AUTH=PLAIN
[250] ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES
[250] 8BITMIME
[250] DSN
[250] CHUNKING

A test email could not be sent.
Error: SMTP Error: 535 5.7.8 Error: authentication failed: Invalid authentication mechanism
```

### What you expected to happen
I expected a successful mail transfer.

body:
`AUTH LOGIN`  is described as [obsolete](https://www.iana.org/assignments/sasl-mechanisms/sasl-mechanisms.xhtml).

`AUTH PLAIN` provides same security level, is common and is likely available if server support `AUTH LOGIN`. It could use 1 step login procedure instead of 3 steps, which could save some time.

So I think it is worth switching to `AUTH PLAIN`.

Simple switch would be to always use `AUTH PLAIN`, but it is not completely BC safe.

Another option is first try `AUTH PLAIN`, then retry with `AUTH LOGIN` if error `504 5.7.4 Unrecognized Authentication Type` received.

More complex path would be parse `EHLO` response line `AUTH LOGIN PLAIN XOAUTH2 PLAIN-CLIENTTOKEN OAUTHBEARER XOAUTH` to select known mechanism.

> So I think it is worth switching to `AUTH PLAIN`.
> 
> Simple switch would be to always use `AUTH PLAIN`, but it is not completely BC safe.

Seems like switching to AUTH PLAIN should be safe.
Given that `AUTH LOGIN` is obsolete perhaps this should be fixed for 3.8, unless 3.9.0 is going to be our next release.
We'll probably do a 3.8 release just for the docbloc fixes so might as well.
I did a small hack to get it running for now. Take a look and/or take the code if you want: https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/compare/master...wnhre2ur8cxx8:smtp_auth_plain

> Another option is first try AUTH PLAIN, then retry with AUTH LOGIN if error 504 5.7.4 Unrecognized Authentication Type received.

Following patch implements above (diff is against `master`).

https://gist.github.com/ADmad/6727d9c4be5cb58a021ce808228f0e2b
@wnhre2ur8cxx8 Would you be able to test the patch that ADmad put together?

> @wnhre2ur8cxx8 Would you be able to test the patch that ADmad put together?

Just did, the patch works as intended for my PLAIN only setup.

issue.title: Add support for SMTP authentication: AUTH PLAIN.

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

Fixes #14634
